intro: Elaphrium octandrum, commonly known as the eight-branch elaphrium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
